Object.Field: LKM Hyperion Financial Management Data to SQL

Author: Sunopsis Version: 4.0 Last update: Oct 17 - 2007
Description: - Loading Knowledge Module - Loads data from an ASCII or EBCDIC File to any ISO-92 compliant database. - This module uses Sunopsis Agent to read selected data from the HFM Application and write the result in the target temporary table created dynamically.
Restrictions: - This module will not work if you change the column names of the HFMData data store reverse engineered by the RKM Hyperion Financial Mangement knowlege module.

Specifies the set of Entity dimension members for which you are extracting data. You can specify comma-delimited members or a single member. If you do not specify any value, the system extracts data for all entities. To specify the parent and child, separate them by a period, for example, ?East Region. East Sales?.
Flag to indicate if logging should be performed during the load process. If set to Yes, logging would be done to the file specified by the LOG_FILE_NAME option.
The fully qualified name of the file into which logging is to be done.

Specifies the set of Period dimension members for which you are extracting data. You can specify only range of members using ~ character between start and end period, e.g. 1~3. You can specify multiple Period intervals e.g 1~3, 5 ~9. If you do not specify a member, the system extracts data for the first period only.

Specifies the set of Scenario dimension members for which you are extracting data. You can specify comma-delimited scenario members or a single member. If you do not specify a scenario, the system extracts data for all scenarios.

Specifies the View dimension member for which you are exporting data. Valid values are: Periodic; YTD; <Scenario View>. If you do not specify any View the system extracts data for <Scenario View> view.

Specifies the set of Year dimension members for which you are exporting data. You can specify comma-delimited years or a single year. If you do not specify any value, the system extracts data for all Years.

Specifies the set of Account dimension members for which you are exporting data. You can specify comma-delimited account members or a single member. If you do not specify an account, the system extracts all account dimension members.
Set this option to NO if you wish to retain temporary objects (tables, files and scripts) after integration. Useful for debugging.

from java.util import HashMap from java.util import Map from java.lang import Boolean from java.lang import Long from com.hyperion.odi.common import ODIConstants from com.hyperion.odi.connection import HypAppConnectionFactory from com.hyperion.odi.hfm import ODIHFMAppReader from com.hyperion.odi.hfm import ODIHFMConstants
# # Source HFM Application connection properties #
serverName = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_DSERV_NAME")%>" userName = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_USER_NAME")%>" password = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_PASS")%>" application = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_CATALOG")%>"
# # Put the connection properites and initialize the HFM App Reader # srcProps = HashMap() srcProps.put(ODIConstants.SERVER,serverName) srcProps.put(ODIConstants.USER,userName) srcProps.put(ODIConstants.PASSWORD,password) srcProps.put(ODIConstants.APPLICATION_NAME,application)
print "Initalizing the HFM App Reader and connecting" hfmAppReader = HypAppConnectionFactory.getAppReader(HypAppConnectionFactory.APP_HFM, srcProps);
print "Connected." connection = odiRef.getJDBCConnection("DEST") stagingTableName = ' <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "COLL_NAME", "W")%>'
print "Staging table Name is %s" % stagingTableName
stagCols = '<%=odiRef.getColList("", "[CX_COL_NAME]=[COL_NAME] ", ", ", "", "")%>' print "Staging Columns %s" % stagCols # #extract the LKM Options # logEnabled = <%=odiRef.getOption("LOG_ENABLED")%> logFileName = r"<%=odiRef.getOption("LOG_FILE_NAME")%>" sDestBatchUpdateSize=<?if("".equals(odiRef.getInfo("DEST_BATCH_UPDATE"))){out.print("1000");}else{out.print(odiRef.getInfo("DEST_BATCH_UPDATE"));}?> destBatchUpdateSize = Long(sDestBatchUpdateSize)
scenarioFilter = "<%=odiRef.getOption("SCENARIO_FILTER")%>" yearFilter = "<%=odiRef.getOption("YEAR_FILTER")%>" periodFilter = "<%=odiRef.getOption("PERIOD_FILTER")%>" accountFilter = "<%=odiRef.getOption("ACCOUNT_FILTER")%>" viewFilter = "<%=odiRef.getOption("VIEW_FILTER")%>" entityFilter = "<%=odiRef.getOption("ENTITY_FILTER")%>"
#set the extract options
extractOptions = HashMap()
#generic Hyperion ODI Knowledge module options extractOptions.put(ODIConstants.LOG_ENABLED, Boolean(logEnabled)) extractOptions.put(ODIConstants.LOG_FILE_NAME, logFileName)
#HFM specific extract options extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_SOURCECONNECTION, connection) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_COLUMNMAP, stagCols) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_TABLENAME,stagingTableName) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_LKMDATA_SCENARIO_FILTER,scenarioFilter) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_LKMDATA_YEAR_FILTER,yearFilter) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_LKMDATA_PERIOD_FILTER,periodFilter) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_LKMDATA_ACCOUNT_FILTER,accountFilter) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_LKMDATA_ENTITY_FILTER,entityFilter) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_LKMDATA_VIEW_FILTER,viewFilter) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.MODEL_TABLETYPE_KEY, ODIHFMConstants.MODEL_TABLETYPE_DATA) extractOptions.put(ODIHFMConstants.OPTIONS_NAME_LKMDATA_BATCH_UPDATE_SIZE, destBatchUpdateSize)
hfmAppReader.beginExtract(extractOptions)
statString = stats.toString() raise "HFM Data Extract Summary", statString
